description: Chroma, one of super-cyber agent Motoko Aramkai's cyborg surrogate operatives, has a little problem. She's not sure whether she's in the real world or inside a game...but either way, there are plenty of well-armed weirdoes going all-out to turn Chroma into a grease-spot, virtual and/or literal. And real or not, their goal is to find a way to get to Motoko, and she may have unwittingly provided them with the means to track her down...and rub her out! The brain-twisting followup to the manga/anime classicGhost in the Shell, Shirow Masamune's Man-Machine Interface redefines the limits of "comic book" to create an immersing visual landscape unlike anything seen before in graphic fiction.
name: Ghost in the Shell 2 : Man Machine Interface

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description: There is one battle you cannot win, a battle in which you become your own worst enemy. In this third and concluding chapter of "Arcadia Nocturne," Ghost's demonic new adversary, Cameron Nemo, ushers her on a treacherous, deadly journey... inside herself. It's a brief glimpse at the past of the mysterious Ghost... a glimpse she may not survive!
name: Arcadia Nocturne Part 3

description:
Overview
The beautiful and deadly Major Kusanagi and her crack team of Internal Affairs operatives are sent to investigate a government factory with questionable labor practices, but the factory is ready to defend itself! All in a day's work, except this time, the major and her team aren't sure if they will still have jobs when -- or if -- they return!
name: Ghost in the Shell

description:
Overview

Deep into the twenty-first century, the line between man and machine has been inexorably blurred as humans rely on the enhancement of mechanical implants and robots are upgraded with human tissue. In this rapidly converging technoscape, the covert-ops agents of Section 9 are charged to track and crack the most dangerous terrorists, cybercriminals, and ghost hackers. And speaking of ghosts, when supposedly dead people start turning up walking and talking, Section 9 begins to look into the possibility that corpses are being "puppeted" from a remote location, and some serious powerbrokers may be pulling the strings.

Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human-Error Processor presents for the first time in America the "lost" Ghost in the Shell stories, created by Shirow Masamune after completing work on the original Ghost in the Shellmanga and prior to his tour-de-force, Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface, but never collected until now. Focusing on Section 9 agents in their daily battle against technocrime, Human-Error Processor has all the mind-twisting cybermadness you've come to expect from Ghost in the Shell but set in a more police-procedural context with action and suspense galore.

This first issue features part one of "Fat Cat," the first of four Ghost in the Shell tales.
name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description: Being new to the world of the living dead, Ghost is asking several questions of herself: Why was I killed? Who killed me? Why do I hate so much? Ghost begins to search for answers by investigating the life of her sister Margo, but once she learns her sibling's dark secret, she may want to mind her own business.
name: Arcadia Nocturne Part 1

description: As Ghost digs deeper into her former life for clues to her previous existence, she enlists the aid of King Tiger, but the answers King Tiger provides may not be what Ghost wants to hear. Ghost now deals with a new, demonic foe who is unleashed in the streets of Arcadia. He will become Ghost's greatest enemy.
name: Arcadia Nocturne Part 2

description: All Elisa Cameron wants is a decent job, an average apartment . . . a normal life. But what she has is a paranormal life! Elisa Cameron is Ghost, and if she survives her run-in with a legion of paranormal Ghosthunters she'll still have to duck the deadly devices of The Predator!
name: Trophy Ghost

description: Tne tough dame deserves another! This month, you'll get the confrontation you've been waiting for when the enigmatic Ghost meets the bounty-hunting Barb Wire! Barb's been sent to Arcadia on a bounty, but she's gonna get more than she bargained for! Is there enough room in any city for these two gun-toting women? Find out in Ghost #4!
name: Reflections

description: An assassin called "The Hunger" has been hired to eliminate Ghost. Hunger's first problem: How do you kill someone who's already dead? And his second problem: Dead or not, she's no easy target. But Hunger's libidinous paranormal power may just make him more than Ghost can handle!
name: Hunger

description: It's Halloween in Arcadia, except here they call it Hell Night. Tonight, Ghost takes a paranormal bus ride right out of an ectoplasmic version of Speed. Her final destination is the old "underground city" beneath Arcadia, where all of Ghost's past enemies are waiting to pounce: Snake Eyes, Hunger, MacCready and Joe Yimbo! And they've all been gathered courtesy of the mysterious Dr. October. For Ghost, Hell Night is a gauntlet of deadly tricks. For the readers, it's all Ghostly treats!
name: Hell Night

description: Ghost is neck deep in the worst kind of terror when she awakens to find herself trapped in Hell! She's being clawed and pawed by the legions of the damned. She has no idea how she got there, and no idea how to get out. For all her power, for all her will, does Ghost stand a chance in Hell?
name: Hell

description: Dr. October, Joe Yimbo, Snake-Eyes, Hunger, and MacCready -- five evil men with a single, horrible goal: To end Ghost's ectoplasmic existence forever! And if they can't destroy her, they'll at least take down a big piece of Arcadia, which will get them X-actly the wrong kind of attention!
name: Retribution

description: Ghost thought she had experienced the worst tortures of hell. But she was wrong. Dead wrong. And Scythe and his trio of "Furies" intend to prove that point.
name: Descent

description:
Overview

In the tortured, demon-ruled interior of her mind, Ghost hides out from the one enemy she cannot face -- her sister, Margo. Transformed by the man named Scythe, Margo has become a demonic primal version of herself, hell-bent on Ghost's destruction.
name: Crack in the Wall

description: Since she first discovered her unique abilities, Ghost has walked the narrow line just this side of lawlessness. She's meted her own form of justice, primarily as it served her own ends, but never went over the line. But now, in a farmhouse upstate, Ghost defends the villainous Scythe against the Furies, a band of government-sponsored, super-powered operatives. Ghost has been getting closer to discovering the secrets of her mysterious past. Now, thanks to Scythe and the Furies, whether or not she'll survive long enough to make use of the information is anybody's guess!
name: Battleground

description: Ghost is no stranger to the specter of death -- her blazing .45s have often dispensed their ultimate justice. But the tables have turned, and it is she who is being stalked by death. Her friends, her business associates, and her parents have all been killed since she acquired her strange powers . . . and now her sister Margo has been taken from her as well. Someone -- or something -- is systematically destroying every trace of Ghost's existence, and she finds herself alone, preparing for the battle of her afterlife.
name: Requiem

description: Her name is Miasma, and she likes her kills up close and personal. She has the ability to become anybody -- your friend, your relative, your lover -- so that the last thing you see is the lie that ends your life. That makes her one of Arcadia's deadliest assassins -- and one of Ghost's deadliest targets.
name: Miasma

description: Ghost is on a killing spree, and no gangster in Arcadia is safe! From the lowliest grifter to the biggest crime boss, they've all become targets. Only it's not Ghost who's doing the killing -- it's Miasma, who has taken control of Ghost's body. The all-female super team The Furies are coming to the rescue, but if they'd bothered to ask Ghost, she'd have told them save their strength . . . it's already too late!
name: Rampage

description: Miasma possessed Ghost's body. She destroyed her past and has ruined her future. The only thing left for Miasma is to kill Ghost, and even that would be merciful. But Ghost has seen death already; she knows there are worse things than the grave. And she's about to show Miasma just what those things are . . .
name: Hell and Back

description: One by one, everybody who Elisa Cameron ever loved has died -- each one taking a part of her with them. Now, in an effort to make herself whole once again, and so that her loved ones will not have died in vain, Elisa unearths her memories of them -- cutting through the haze of time to walk the streets of "Dead City."
name: Dead City

description: The first time they crossed paths, Elisa was asking for her help. This time, Steel Harbor's Barb Wire needs assistance that only Ghost can give -- a job that requires a road trip complete with motorcycles and biker leathers. Thelma and Louise got nothing on these two bad girls. Just don't call either one of them "babe."
name: Black Heart

description: Welcome to Black Heart, Nebraska, your average, middle-American small town -- that's been taken over by a demon maniac! Ghost and Barb Wire came here looking for a friend, but now they're just looking for a way out. Their only hope of escape may mean killing innocent civilians . . . or doing something that neither one of them ever dreamed of.
name: Black Heart Part II

description: Back in Arcadia after her road trip with Barb Wire, Ghost discovers that the mobs haven't forgotten her in her absence -- she's still number one on their hit parade. Funny thing is, the goons who are coming after her would all rather die than reveal who sent them. There are some clues, but to decipher them Elisa needs the help of someone who knows Arcadia's darkest secrets -- the man known only as X!
name: Exhuming Elisa Part 1

description: Ghost has discovered the identity of the man who controls most of the organized crime in Arcadia -- the man who knows the secret behind her death and her spectral transformation. And she's not alone in this discovery -- X has found him, too. But before they can move against him, he traps them in a seemingly inescapable prison where they are forced to either depend on each other for survival or kill each other to escape! Two heroes, one room, a story you will never forget!
name: Exhuming Elisa Part 2: Embers

description: "The key is forever beyond your reach." That was the note a killer left on the bodies of Elisa Cameron's parents. Elisa found a similar note at the scene of her own death. She may not have the key, but she has discovered what it unlocks: the entrance to a secret underground city beneath Arcadia -- guarded by a golem, a supernatural being of living clay! Ghost is up to her armpits in the arcane, and where magic is involved, can King Tiger be far behind?
name: Exhuming Elisa Part 3: Maps

description: Ghost has unlocked the secrets of the mob's underground city, but she's also discovered another secret of which the criminals are unaware: the city isn't deserted. Meet the "Goblins" -- the wretched, mutated dregs of humanity who are too freakish to live above-ground -- and their diminutive king, Ghost's old adversary, Mr. Mole!
name: Exhuming Elisa Part 4: Necropolis

description: X is dead and Ghost is going to be, if she can't defeat the psychic monster in the secret city beneath Arcadia! Everything's coming to a head as we prepare for the climactic, double-sized twenty-fifth issue of Ghost, which promises to reveal . . . ah, but that would be telling!
name: Exhuming Elisa Part 5: Annihilation

description: She's fought master criminals, mutants, and monsters during her short career, but now Ghost faces a whole army in her defense of the secret underground city beneath Arcadia. This giant-sized, 48-page issue marks the start of a new direction for Ghost, and reveals why Elisa Cameron was killed. Action from start to finish, plus a spectacular photo cover and a special feature on the creators behind Ghost! Don't miss this incredible 25th issue celebration!
name: Elisa Exhumed: Finale

description: Elisa Cameron is the evil White Queen? The eXecutioner and the King of Tigers are her villainous vassals? Doctor October is the valiant October Knight out to save the kingdom of Arcadia? What's going on here? It's a fairy-tale version of Ghost's world turned upside down as writer Eric Luke and artists Scott Benefiel and Jasen Rodriguez (Ghost/Hellboy) allow you a glimpse through Dr. October's eyes. Witness the crystal-vision clearness of her perspectivity! Stand in awareness of her heart-boldened couragitude! And be careful with that jade sword -- it's sharp!
name: October Knight

description: Run through with a jade sword and hung up like a side of beef, Ghost is at the mercy of Doctor October in the conclusion of the two-part story, "October Knight." But as wounded and as weak as she is, Ghost is the only hope for her friends X, King Tiger, and Focus -- all of whom have had their life force drained by the mad Doctor. When you only have a ghost of a chance, it pays to be one!
name: October Day

description: Her name is Jen, and she's decided to end her life rather than face another night of terror from the "thing" in the closet. But Ghost intervenes and sets her on a course for a new place to live . . . a new boyfriend . . . a new life. And that's when everything begins to go horribly wrong. Ghost takes the first step on a path that will lead her to face the truth about her own death! The first in a four-issue story arc leading into Ghost's origin, Painful Music.
name: Painful Music Part 1: Banquet

description: Bad guys beware: there's a new Ghost in town, and her name is not Elisa Cameron! Ghost has a new partner-in-crime-fighting, and she's having a ball showing the newly dead kid the ropes -- until demons from the girl's past show up to take both their souls.
name: Painful Music Part 2: Living in Fear

description: Predators aren't just the freaks who abduct women and children. The ones who have information and only share if there's something in it for them -- they're predators, too. Ghost is on a mission to save her friend's life, and she doesn't have time to play games with predators.
name: Painful Music Part 3: Side Streets

description: In the final notes of "Painful Music," Ghost returns to her graveyard, defeated and degraded. There are pieces of the puzzle still missing -- what really happened at the moment of her death? why has she not passed on? -- pieces she doesn't think she can answer herself. But she won't have to . . .
name: Painful Music Concluded: Transition

description: Peter, a man Ghost barely knows, has been in a coma ever since he risked his life to save hers. Now Ghost's going in after him, to try to salvage whatever's left of his mind -- and her own soul. But to do that, and come out alive, she must walk "A Pathless Land."
name: A Pathless Land

description: A new evil has come to Arcadia -- a series of murders that Ghost, in her new role as guardian of the city, must investigate. The problem is, the crimes are marked by signs of the same kind of rage Elisa herself exhibited upon her rebirth. If Ghost is white death, the killer is the dark . . . her Silhouette. Introducing a most unexpected new villain, and another astonishing turn in Ghost's twisted tale!
name: Jade Cathedral Chapter One: Pursuit

description: Elisa Cameron, aka Ghost, mourned for her sister when she died. But suddenly, inexplicably, Margo has returned from the dead, exhibiting many of the same powers as Ghost -- and a penchant for using those powers to exact a feminist revenge on every male she encounters! Is Margo still the sister Elisa loved, or has she become a villain on a collision course with Ghost?
name: Jade Cathedral Chapter Two: Reunion

description: For interfering with her plans, Silhouette has decided that Ghost must be punished. But how do you punish somebody who's already dead? You destroy that which they love the most -- in this case, the city of Arcadia!
name: Jade Cathedral Chapter Three: Hatred More Fatal

description: The battle between Ghost and her newly resurrected sister comes to an explosive climax high above Arcadia. Ghost's one hope is to reach Margo through their linked pasts, but is blood really thicker than water, or will the demon minions sprung from Margo's tears prevail?
name: Jade Cathedral Chapter Four: Tears of the World

description: Enter the supernatural world of Ghost as a new creative team takes you on a break-neck ride into the darkest part of men's souls! Writer Chris Warner (Black Cross) and exciting new artist Christian Zanier take over the reins of Dark Horse's spectral avenger as her world is turned upside down by one stunning revelation after another! Plus, Warner and Zanier begin unveiling the long-awaited truth behind Ghost's origin!
name: No World so Dark

description:
Overview
Someone is inflicting wetware viruses on government employees, and Togusa has an ex-girlfriend who has fallen victim to the deadly program! Full-metal jacket or encryption-encoded neurovirus: either way, you're staring death in the face! Welcome to the twenty-first century!

Overview
When you build robots with artificial personalities, you risk the chance that they might not want to be treated like appliances. And when you pattern a robot's consciousness on a human template, you're transcribing hopes and fears.

Overview
Some powerful megacorporations seem very interested in a worn-out piece of land just north of Japan. When they get interested enough to kill a rookie cop performing surveillance, Major Kusanagi and her team move in... but will they be able to investigate without sparking an international incident between former rival nations?

Overview
Major Kusanagi gives herself totally to her work. And when she receives a surprise visit from an escaped terrorist, she makes no exception. A pound of 16-penny nails and a hunk of plastique won't stop her from coming out both barrels blazing... even if that means blowing herself sky-high!

Overview
The Major, Batou, Togusa, and Aramaki begin this issue on a search-and-destroy mission. The object of their hunt is a rogue robot who may or may not have a "ghost." As they get closer to the truth, they also get closer to a dangerous situation that could affect the very fabric of their society.

Overview
Sometimes you have to take a life to save a life, and that's just what Kusanagi did to save the Foreign Minister. She took down the terrorist to save the diplomat. Yet, despite that fact, she is sentenced to eight months in prison for use of excessive force. The same prison, it turns out, where the terrorist's pals have been sent for their crimes. Surrounded by enemies, in the darkness of her cell, will Kusanagi last her eight-month sentence? Will she even make that first week?

Overview
The Puppeteer attacks the Major during her most vulnerable moment: the time she leaves her own body in preparation to inhabit a new one! Will the Puppeteer succeed in hijacking her body by destroying her "ghost" to make room for his own? Don't miss this dramatic, climactic final chapter!
After being electocuted by an ancient Aztec device, Daniel Jackson is forced to relive the moment Sha're was taken by Apophis.
name: Daniel's Song

description:
Overview

How do you keep a dead man from being murdered? Business bigwig Hayasaka might be dead, but he keeps turning up walking and talking, and Section 9 agents need to find out whether he's being remotely "puppeted" and whether those pulling the strings-like the mysterious Takoaka of the Institute of Technology-are the same people trying to control access to Pandora, a vast digital treasure trove of information of the most sensitive-and dangerous-nature.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

Top cybercrime agent Motoko Kusanagi has returned--or has she? Well, whoever "Motoko" is--or isn't--she's back on the job with Batou, protecting a comatose key witness from assassination, a killing designed to end the investigation of a case involving lethally defective micro machines. But the bad guys don't only have little machines, they also have great big combat mecha perfectly capable of taking apart the hospital--not to mention Matoko and Batou--to terminate the target!

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

Cybercrime special-ops unit Section 9 has been mobilized to protect a key witness in a trial involving defective micro machines. And the witness definitely needs protection-from remote-controlled corpses packing serious hardware! And if the identity of these dead assassins' pilots isn't enough of a mystery for Section 9, how about the unexpected appearance of long-missing special agent Motoko Kusanagi!

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

Section 9 special agents Batou and Togusa are investigating a series of brutal murders that appear to be linked by the victims' common tattoo, a military design. A found yacht key could help unlock the mystery behind the murders, but if the Section 9 agents want to toss the boat, they'll have to get in line-behind two killer cyborgs with a distinct antipathy for cops!

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

Another grisly murder has been committed, and again the unidentified victim has a military tattoo that's been found on all the bodies in a series of brutal slayings. Section 9 special agents Togusa and Azuma find a destroyed cyborg at the scene, the same killer 'borg who nearly did them in in a previous encounter. Also found are the prints of the last surviving member of the now-slaughtered military team. Is he the final name on the hit list, or is he the mastermind crossing off the names?

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

When a suspected assassin turns up dead alongside a couple of ex-bodyguards of her intended government-minister target, the agents of Section 9 set out to unravel the mystery only to find themselves tied up in a Gordian knot of intrigues and subterfuges. When the minister goes missing, reports surface of an ace-sniper out to punch the big shot's ticket, and the Section 9 agents race against the clock to get to the minister before the assassin's bullet does!

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview

A top government official has disappeared, and superstar-for-hire sniper Yuen Shohoi may have "disappeared" him. But the investigating agents of Section 9 begin to suspect something else afoot-that the minister is in hiding, possessing secrets that others in the government are determined to make sure never see the light of day. And by tracking down the minister, are the agents simply leading the predators to the prey?

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 1.5: Human Error Processor

description:
Overview
March 6, 2035. Motoko Aramaki is a hyper-advanced cyborg, a counter-terrorist net security expert, heading the investigative department of the giant multi-national, Poseidon Industrial. Partly transcending the physical world and existing in a virtual world of networks, Motoko is a fusion of multiple entities and identities, deploying remotely controlled prosthetic humanoid surrogates around the globe to solve a series of bizarre incidents. Meanwhile, Tamaki Tamai, a psychic investigator from the Channeling Agency, has been commissioned to investigate strange changes in the temporal universe, brought about by two forces, one represented by the teachings of a professor named Rahampol, and the other by the complex, evolving Motoko entity. What unfolds will all be in a day's work...a day that will change everything, forever. Man-Machine Interface, the long- awaited sequel to Masamune Shirow's groundbreaking Ghost in the Shelland one of the most highly anticipated comics series in many years, finally reaches American shores. Featuring 100 pages of new art and story created since its original publication, most rendered in dazzling full color with awe-inspiring digital effects on a level never before seen in the annals of graphic fiction. Shirow has raised the bar for what can be achieved on the page, page after page!.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
March 6, 2035 -- four and half years since cyber-cop Matoko Kusanagi joined with an artifical intelligence and quit the 9 Police Squad. Now, a hyper-advanced cyborg called Motoko Aramaki -- a fusion of multiple entities and identities -- heads the investigative department of the giant multi-national, Poseidon Industrial, deploying remotely controlled humanoid surrogates around the globe as on-the-ground agents. When a herd of specially-bred pigs used to clone human organs for transplant are slaughtered, Motoko dispatches herself through cyberspace and utilizing surrogate cyborgs at far-flung locales to do the heavy lifting, Matoko hunts down the attackers, battling online and on the ground, but there may be more to the mystery than meets the eye...even the all-seeing eye of artificial intelligence. No work of graphic fiction you've ever experienced can prepare you for the mind-warping journey that is Man-Machine Interface.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
Cyborg cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki has dispatched a humanoid surrogate -- call her "Clarice" -- to investigate an apparent terrorist attack on a herd of genetically engineered pigs designed for human organ cloning. And no sooner does the surrogate hit the ground in a vehicle assembly plant halfway around the world than she's wrangling a herd of a different kind -- no-nonsense security cyborgs bent on sending her to the cyber-scrapheap. But when Clarice/Matoko jacks into the brain of the facility's supervisor and breaks through network firewalls into the level 6 "ghostline," Motoko discovers that the pig slaughter may have been only a strike against a deeper conspiracy -- and yet another hidden enemy!

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
An important meeting of VIPs at Poseidon Industrial turns to mayhem and then murder right under the nose of cyborg cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki and Poseidon's security team. With the blood still wet on the polished hardwood, Motoko must once again jack into cyberspace and try to solve the crime with the use of one of her cyborg surrogates -- providing her surrogate survives a knock-down drag-out encounter with a hit team of murderous machines! The mind-blowing sequel to the manga/anime classic Ghost in the Shell, Masamune Shirow's Man-Machine Interface shatters the boundaries of graphic fiction, conjuring a fully realized visual reality unlike anything seen before but certain to be imitated for years to come.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
Cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki remains hot on the trail of the shadowy terrorists making life hell for Poseidon Industrial. Motoko deploys a cyborg surrogate, Chroma, for on-the-ground operations to pick up needed information, but while waiting for an e-brain private eye to pony up the data, Chroma is jacked into a no-holds-barred virtual combat game--at least she hopes it's virtual! The synapse-frying followup to the manga/anime heavyweight champion, Ghost in the Shell, Shirow Masamune's Man-Machine Interfacecrushes to powder any previous notions of what is or is not a comic book with its dizzying storyline and cutting-edge, digitally enhanced visuals, unlike anything comics have ever offered.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
After arriving at the ocean-floating Poseidon Industrial Headquarters, super cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki is determined to infiltrate into the Decatoncale supercomputer, one of only three such systems on earth. But breaking through Poseidon's security into the network won't exactly be a walk in the park, and even if she manage to jack in, the dangers of the virtual dimension are every bit as deadly!

The mind-mulching sequel to the manga/anime classicGhost in the Shell, Shirow Masamune's Man-Machine Interface takes comics to a level never-before-seen, creating a fever-dream cyberscape of spectacular--and disturbing--realism.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description: Having jacked-in to the Decatonale supercomputer, cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki is hot on the virtual trail of the mystery entity behind the wave of terrorist sattacks rocking Poseidon International's world. And that trail leads through Millennium, another formidable--and not hard to look at!--cybernaut who's ready, willing, and able to run Motoko through the digital shredder! The synapse-sizzling sequel to the manga/anime classic Ghost in the Shell, Shirow Masamune's Man-Machine Interface takes graphic fiction to a new plateau, creating breathtaking images and dizzying concepts of astonishing complexity and originality.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
Deep inside the electronic infinity of the enemy Decatonale supercomputer, cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki plays hide-and-seek with the system's digital defenses to get the root of the terrorist attacks plaguing Poseidon International. It's been a tough cyber-fight, but one that becomes even tougher when Motoko Aramaki encounters a new adversary, the one-and-only Motoko Kusanagi, whose personality is embedded in the core of her own multi-identity. And when the entities begin to spontaneously fuse, the existence of each -- or both! -- hangs in the balance! The consciousness-altering sequel to the manga/anime classic Ghost in the Shell, Shirow Masamune's Man-Machine Interface takes graphic fiction into unexplored territory, a hallucinatory dreamscape of unforgettable visions and unimaginable ideas.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
Even for the hallucinatory, infinite landscape of cyberspace, stuff's getting out of hand! Deep within the digital universe of the Decontale supercomputer, super cyber-agent Motoko Aramaki is in deep trouble. It's tough enough running the risk of being caught by heavily-armed security in the real world, but when Matoko is being given the business by the godlike avatars in the virtual world, Matoko runs an even greater risk: assimilation and erasure! The astonishing sequel to the manga/anime classic Ghost in the Shell, Masamune Shirow's Man-Machine Interface takes graphic fiction into unexplored realms, creating a fully-realized digital dreamscape that takes readers to the edge of tomorrow and to a coming age where the nature of existence itself will be deconstructed, reassembled, and redefined.

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description:
Overview
Roaring down the final stretch, Man-Machine Interfacereaches its explosive climax as master storytelling visionary Masamune Shirow continues to tear down the walls between actual and virtual, flesh and circuit, soul and science. Shirow has crafted a true 21st Century epic of monumental visual complexity and staggering conceptual depth, almost as though Shirow were writing for an audience already living in the future he envisions. Breathtaking, challenging, and a little dangerous, Man-Machine Interface is a graphic-fiction masterpiece that will be read, re-read, and argued about for years to come! Translation by Frederik L. Schodt (Ghost in the Shell, Astro Boy).

volume.name: Ghost in the Shell 2: Man-Machine Interface

description: The battle against Sinestro corps continues on Earth! Where Anti monitor waits for our gallant heroes...
name: Sinestro Corps War Part 9: Endgame

character_credits.name: Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 1679
Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 2082

character_died_in.name: Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 1679
Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 2082

first_appearance_characters.name: Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 1679
Sinestro Corps Soldier of Space Sector 2082

description: VERTIGO's smart, sassy, butt-kicking new monthly continues. After last issue's shocking revelation, Angela St. Grace tries to come to terms with who she is and what her future path will be. Not the easiest task, especially in the middle of an all-out, pull-the-roof-down war between G.O.O.D. and E.V.I.L. Plus, the sinister seductress Anita Manaday takes on her greatest challenge: Go-Go!
name: The Devil You Say Part 2

description: "Little Orphan Angela." Heartache tinges the satire in this stand-alone issue, as Angela is forced to make a momentous decision. Having broken her ties with both G.O.O.D. and E.V.I.L., Angela St. Grace flees to New York, where she tries to live a normal life. But the secrecy and danger of her old life catch up with her, threatening her newfound normalcy, and her budding romance with an average, decent, caring man.
name: The Devil You Say Epilogue: Little Orphan Angela

description: "St. Grace Under Fire." In this stand-alone issue, Go-Go Fiasco takes us on a "fleshback" to the sexy Seventies, where we discover how Angela's mom, the original Girl Who Made G.O.O.D., and Damon Devlin, her arch enemy, first met and fell in lust. Watch the sparks fly as these two heat up the Cold War!
name: Fleshback '73: St. Grace Under Fire

description: "Arms and Legs for Hostages," Part 1 of 2. Angela goes undercover, and under covers, to rescue two young girls from an African dictator's clutches. But there's a mole in the presidential palace! Will Angela be exposed? Even more than she's used to?
name: Arms (and Legs) for Hostages, Part One

description: "Arms (and Legs) for Hostages," Part 2 of 2. When Angela and Go-Go are trapped inside an African dictator's palace, their covers are blown, their mission is aborted, and the presidential guard is hot on their heels. It's cover-to-cover action (well, okay, some cheesecake, too), capped by a spectacular betrayal!
name: Arms (and Legs) for Hostages, Part II

description: "Go-Go A-Go-Go." After quarrelling with Angela, Go-Go tries to lose himself in New York's gay club scene. But after a night of revelry, a chance encounter results in his being bashed...by Angela! Is it really happening, or is it bad vibes from a party drug? Disturbing doubts take shape in this stand- alone issue.
name: Go-Go A-Go-Go

description: "A is for Anarchy, B is for Bomb." Finally, the story of how Angela and Go-Go met! In this "fleshback" to 1997, we find Angela enrolled at Signora Carichana's Swiss finishing school. But wait till you see what's on the lesson plan! And where exactly does Go-Go fit into an all-female student body?
name: Fleshback '97: A is for Anarchy...B is for Bomb!

description: She's back, the uncanny Una Enigma! Angela and Go-Go trail the mysterious super-spy to Greece, in an effort to discover who, or what, she really is. But an explosive turn of events on the island of Paros just might make the whole question academic.
name: Enigma Variations

description:
Enterprise crew fight the Borg in the mid 21st century!

Based on the movie.
name: Star Trek First Contact

description: On her own in Siberia, beyond the reach of both G.O.O.D. and E.V.I.L., Angela must rescue herself and two dozen other women from being sold into sexual slavery. But how can she save them if they don't want to be saved?
name: Undressed to Kill, Part Two

description: Angela takes on the hulking Russian crime boss Evgenia Orlova in hand-to-hand combat, for control of a Siberian sex slave camp. Plus, the astonishing story of what (and who) Go-Go's been up to, with art by special guest-penciller Phil Jimenez (WONDER WOMAN)!
name: Undressed to Kill, Conclusion

description: "Undressed to Kill" Part 1 of 3. Angela Devlin heads to Paris, on the trail of a fiendish Russian slavemaster. But who apprehends whom? Plus, Go-Go is confronted with the truth about his origins!
name: Undressed to Kill, Part One

description: A standalone issue. In Mussolini's Italy, Go-Go's anarchist mother, Fiorella Fiasco, battles Angela's secret agent grandmother, Pearlie Gates. Throw in the pint-size Italian spitfire Bamboletta, and it's a Golden Age she-devil spectacular! Meow!
name: Fleshback '32: Arrivederci, Roma

description: She's a sexy secret agent with ties to two opposing agencies; her partner's a fast-talking gay whiz kid. Angela Devlin and Go-Go Fiasco, right? Wrong! We're talking Britain's top espionage team, Divinita Beastly and Ravish Kinkimanboi. Will they become our heroes' allies...or their replacements? Find out in this standalone issue!
name: H.E.A.V.E.N. Sent

description: Where have all the good days gone, when G.O.O.D. was good and E.V.I.L. was evil? Catch up with the entire KNOCKOUT cast and find out what has been happening since we last saw them. This frenetically paced issue also serves as the prologue to the next 3-issue action-packed storyline, and is penciled by Ed Benes ? fresh from a run on WildStorm's GEN13. It's time to jump on the bandwagon!
name: Amok in America: Prologue

description: Angela returns to California for a showdown with G.O.O.D. Meanwhile, the woman who has shadowed her life since the series began goes on a rampage in New York. Plus, Anita Manaday confronts Damon Devlin about their terrible shared secret. All this, and Go-Go goes skinny- dipping!
name: Amok in America: Part One

description: Angela forces a stunning revelation from her mother that has dire consequences for her immediate future. Meanwhile, Damon makes a fateful decision. And Go-Go finally gets out of the pool!
name: Amok in America: Part Two

description: The moment you've been waiting for: Angela meets Amora, the woman who's shadowed her life since the series began! And if that's not fireworks enough: Anita Manaday learns of Damon Devlin's treachery, and Go-Go finally faces John Thomas, freelance detective!
name: Amok in America: Part Three

description: Finally: the origin of the Kevins! In this "Fleshback" to 1969, the original Kevin teams up with sizzling superspy Godiva Priestly to save the lives of the British Royal Family...and unknowingly lays the groundwork for his own peculiar brand of immortality. Featuring the sizzling pencils of newcomer Mark A. Robinson!
name: Fleshback '69: Queen, Castle, Pawn

description: Angela and Rebel Yell infiltrate E.V.I.L. headquarters in an effort to get the goods on Angela's late sister, but the rumors of her death have been greatly exaggerated, as a deadly potentially lethal encounter soon teaches them. Plus, the return of the pastel ninjas!
name: Secrets and Thighs, Part  One

description: Go-Go and his mother return from Switzerland just in time for a deadly showdown with Malevola Devlin! Plus, Angela confronts Anita Manaday, with eye-scratching consequences! And the plot against G.O.O.D. gains new ground as John Thomas gets down and dirty!
name: Secrets and Thighs, Part  Two

description: Final Issue. For decades, G.O.O.D. and E.V.I.L. have waged battle with each other across the globe. Now one of these agencies is brought to a ruinous collapse, never again to rise. Join Angela, Go-Go and their friends for this climactic end of an era, and for the shocking personal revelations that set it all in motion.
name: Secrets and Thighs, Part  Three

description: In the stand-alone "Rebel Yell," Angela faces a mysterious masked opponent who literally explodes into her life. Plus, Go-Go reunites with his anarchist mother...and a villain from the past who wants them both dead!
name: Rebel Yell

description:
Kirk and Picard meet.

Based on the movie.
name: Star Trek Generations

description: A young runaway named Rain finds herself the unwilling human witness to a mysterious and terrifying supernatural court: five tortured spirits who haunt a majestic old Seattle mansion.
name: Foundation, Part One

description: Rain's true backstory begins to emerge in flashbacks, and it is nothing like what she has been telling Traci and Ben!
name: Foundation, Part Two

description: Rain has to get Ben and Traci out of the house in order to safely perform her Witness duties.
name: Foundation, Part Three

description: When Erik is tried in the House of Secrets, his past is revealed!
name: Foundation, Part Four

description: A threatened suicide, police blockades, and leering spectators all herald the return of a missing resident of the House of Secrets as Rain, Ben and Traci's ambitious, harrowing, and soul-shaping road trip draws to a close. High atop one of San Francisco's most famous landmarks, Rain must put her penchant for lying to a new purpose...saving the life of someone in need.
name: The Road To You, Leaving There: Part One of Three

story_arc_credits.name: The Road To You, Leaving There

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: The Road To You, Leaving There

description: After returning to Seattle, Rain discovers that the deal she made with Pfaultz in the past is still held over her head.
name: The Road To You, Leaving There: Part Two of Three

story_arc_credits.name: The Road To You, Leaving There

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: The Road To You, Leaving There
